limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

action.description: The action to be taken by this job.

ads_streams_replicated.description: The number of ads streams replicated by this job.

block_specs_replicated.description: The number of block specs replicated by this job.

bytes_recoverable.description: The number of bytes recoverable by this job.

bytes_transferred.description: The number of bytes that have been transferred by this job.

char_specs_replicated.description: The number of char specs replicated by this job.

corrected_lins.description: The number of LINs corrected by this job.

dirs_changed.description: The number of directories changed by this job.

dirs_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted by this job.

dirs_moved.description: The number of directories moved by this job.

dirs_new.description: The number of directories created by this job.

duration.description: The amount of time in seconds between when the job was started and when it ended.  If the job has not yet ended, this is the amount of time since the job started.  This field is null if the job has not yet started.

end_time.description: The time the job ended in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't ended.

error.description: The primary error message for this job.

error_checksum_files_skipped.description: The number of files with checksum errors skipped by this job.

error_io_files_skipped.description: The number of files with io errors skipped by this job.

error_net_files_skipped.description: The number of files with network errors skipped by this job.

errors.description: A list of error messages for this job.

failed_chunks.description: Tyhe number of data chunks that failed transmission.

fifos_replicated.description: The number of fifos replicated by this job.

file_data_bytes.description: The number of bytes tranferred that belong to files.

files_changed.description: The number of files changed by this job.

files_linked.description: The number of files linked by this job.

files_new.description: The number of files created by this job.

files_selected.description: The number of files selected by this job.

files_transferred.description: The number of files transfered by this job.

files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked by this job.

files_with_ads_replicated.description: The number of files with ads replicated by this job.

flipped_lins.description: The number of LINs flipped by this job.

hard_links_replicated.description: The number of hard links replicated by this job.

hash_exceptions_fixed.description: The number of hash exceptions fixed by this job.

hash_exceptions_found.description: The number of hash exceptions found by this job.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

lins_total.description: The number of LINs tranferred by this job.

network_bytes_to_source.description: The total number of bytes sent to the source by this job.

network_bytes_to_target.description: The total number of bytes sent to the target by this job.

new_files_replicated.description: The number of new files replicated by this job.

num_retransmitted_files.description: The number of files that have been retransmitted by this job.

phases.description: Data for each phase of this job.

end_time.description: The time the job ended this phase.

phase.description: The phase that the job was in.

start_time.description: The time the job began this phase.

policy.description: The policy associated with this job, or null if there is currently no policy associated with this job (this can happen if the job is newly created and not yet fully populated in the underlying database).

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

or_criteria.description: An array containing objects with "and_criteria" properties, each set of and_criteria will be logically OR'ed together to create the full file matching pattern.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". Note: For time types (accessed_*, birth_*, and changed_*), operator is not required (it is implicitly ==).  For the value, you can use a relative date and time, such as "two weeks ago", or specific date and time, such as "January 1, 2012."  Time settings are based on a 24-hour clock.

attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

policy_action.description: This is the action the policy is configured to perform.

resynced_lins.description: The number of LINs resynched by this job.

retransmitted_files.description: The files that have been retransmitted by this job.

retry.description: The number of times the job has been retried.

running_chunks.description: The number of data chunks currently being transmitted.

sockets_replicated.description: The number of sockets replicated by this job.

source_bytes_recovered.description: The number of bytes recovered on the source.

source_directories_created.description: The number of directories created on the source.

source_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the source.

workers_per_node.description: Only valid for allow_write, and allow_write_revert; specify the desired workers per node, defaults to 3.

PUT_args.description: Perform an action (pause, cancel, etc...) on a single job.

duration.description: Total duration in seconds for temporary licenses.

expiration.description: Unix epoch time the license will expire.

name.description: Name of the licensed feature.

force.description: Ignore any running jobs when preparing to delete a policy.

local_only.description: Skip deleting the policy association on the target.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

scope.description: If specified as "effective" or not specified, all fields are returned.  If specified as "user", only fields with non-default values are shown.  If specified as "default", the original values are returned.

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

burst_mode.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable UDP-based data transfer.

changelist.description: If true, retain previous source snapshot and incremental repstate, both of which are required for changelist creation.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_stf.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable the 6.5+ STF based data transfer and uses only treewalk.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.  If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

has_sync_state.description: This field is false if the policy is in its initial sync state and true otherwise.  Setting this field to false will reset the policy's sync state.

id.description: The system ID given to this sync policy.

last_job_state.description: This is the state of the most recent job for this policy.

last_started.description: The most recent time a job was started for this policy.  Value is null if the policy has never been run.

last_success.description: Timestamp of last known successfully completed syncronization.  Value is null if the policy has never completed successfully.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

next_run.description: This is the next time a job is scheduled to run for this policy in Unix epoch seconds.  This field is null if the job is not scheduled.

password_set.description: Indicates if a password is set for accessing the target cluster. Password value is not shown with GET.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

pool.description: The pool to restrict replication policies to.

subnet.description: The subnet to restrict replication policies to.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the source data will be taken on the source cluster before a sync.

source_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the source cluster.

source_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the source cluster before a sync.

target_compare_initial_sync.description: If true, the target creates diffs against the original sync.

target_detect_modifications.description: If true, target cluster will detect if files have been changed on the target by legacy tree walk syncs.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

target_snapshot_alias.description: The alias of the snapshot taken on the target cluster after the sync completes. A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

target_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the target data will be taken on the target cluster after successful sync completions.

workers_per_node.description: The number of worker threads on a node performing a sync.

local_only.description: Skip deleting the policy association on the target.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

burst_mode.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable UDP-based data transfer.

changelist.description: If true, retain previous source snapshot and incremental repstate, both of which are required for changelist creation.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_stf.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable the 6.5+ STF based data transfer and uses only treewalk.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

or_criteria.description: An array containing objects with "and_criteria" properties, each set of and_criteria will be logically OR'ed together to create the full file matching pattern.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". Note: For time types (accessed_*, birth_*, and changed_*), operator is not required (it is implicitly ==).  For the value, you can use a relative date and time, such as "two weeks ago", or specific date and time, such as "January 1, 2012."  Time settings are based on a 24-hour clock.

attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.  If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

has_sync_state.description: This field is false if the policy is in its initial sync state and true otherwise.  Setting this field to false will reset the policy's sync state.

id.description: The system ID given to this sync policy.

last_job_state.description: This is the state of the most recent job for this policy.

last_started.description: The most recent time a job was started for this policy.  Value is null if the policy has never been run.

last_success.description: Timestamp of last known successfully completed syncronization.  Value is null if the policy has never completed successfully.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

next_run.description: This is the next time a job is scheduled to run for this policy in Unix epoch seconds.  This field is null if the job is not scheduled.

password_set.description: Indicates if a password is set for accessing the target cluster. Password value is not shown with GET.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

pool.description: The pool to restrict replication policies to.

subnet.description: The subnet to restrict replication policies to.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the source data will be taken on the source cluster before a sync.

source_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the source cluster.

source_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the source cluster before a sync.

target_compare_initial_sync.description: If true, the target creates diffs against the original sync.

target_detect_modifications.description: If true, target cluster will detect if files have been changed on the target by legacy tree walk syncs.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

target_snapshot_alias.description: The alias of the snapshot taken on the target cluster after the sync completes. A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

target_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the target data will be taken on the target cluster after successful sync completions.

target_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the target cluster.

target_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the target cluster after the sync completes.  A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

workers_per_node.description: The number of worker threads on a node performing a sync.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

password.description: The password for the target cluster.  This field is not readable.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

POST_args.description: Reset a SyncIQ policy incremental state and force a full sync/copy.

POST_input_schema.description: Any empty JSON object is required.

id.description: ID of created item that can be used to refer to item in the collection-item resource path.

GET_args.description: Get a list of SyncIQ reports.  By default 10 reports are returned per policy, unless otherwise specified by 'reports_per_policy'.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

newer_than.description: Filter the returned reports to include only those whose jobs started more recently than the specified number of days ago.

policy_name.description: Filter the returned reports to include only those with this policy name.

reports_per_policy.description: If specified, only the N most recent reports will be returned per policy.  If no other query args are present this argument defaults to 10.

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

state.description: Filter the returned reports to include only those whose jobs are in this state.

action.description: The action to be taken by this job.

ads_streams_replicated.description: The number of ads streams replicated by this job.

block_specs_replicated.description: The number of block specs replicated by this job.

bytes_recoverable.description: The number of bytes recoverable by this job.

bytes_transferred.description: The number of bytes that have been transferred by this job.

char_specs_replicated.description: The number of char specs replicated by this job.

corrected_lins.description: The number of LINs corrected by this job.

dead_node.description: This field is true if the node running this job is dead.

dirs_changed.description: The number of directories changed by this job.

dirs_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted by this job.

dirs_moved.description: The number of directories moved by this job.

dirs_new.description: The number of directories created by this job.

duration.description: The amount of time in seconds between when the job was started and when it ended.  If the job has not yet ended, this is the amount of time since the job started.  This field is null if the job has not yet started.

end_time.description: The time the job ended in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't ended.

error.description: The primary error message for this job.

error_checksum_files_skipped.description: The number of files with checksum errors skipped by this job.

error_io_files_skipped.description: The number of files with io errors skipped by this job.

error_net_files_skipped.description: The number of files with network errors skipped by this job.

errors.description: A list of error messages for this job.

failed_chunks.description: Tyhe number of data chunks that failed transmission.

fifos_replicated.description: The number of fifos replicated by this job.

file_data_bytes.description: The number of bytes tranferred that belong to files.

files_changed.description: The number of files changed by this job.

files_linked.description: The number of files linked by this job.

files_new.description: The number of files created by this job.

files_selected.description: The number of files selected by this job.

files_transferred.description: The number of files transfered by this job.

files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked by this job.

files_with_ads_replicated.description: The number of files with ads replicated by this job.

flipped_lins.description: The number of LINs flipped by this job.

hard_links_replicated.description: The number of hard links replicated by this job.

hash_exceptions_fixed.description: The number of hash exceptions fixed by this job.

hash_exceptions_found.description: The number of hash exceptions found by this job.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

lins_total.description: The number of LINs tranferred by this job.

network_bytes_to_source.description: The total number of bytes sent to the source by this job.

network_bytes_to_target.description: The total number of bytes sent to the target by this job.

new_files_replicated.description: The number of new files replicated by this job.

num_retransmitted_files.description: The number of files that have been retransmitted by this job.

phases.description: Data for each phase of this job.

end_time.description: The time the job ended this phase.

phase.description: The phase that the job was in.

start_time.description: The time the job began this phase.

resynced_lins.description: The number of LINs resynched by this job.

sparse_data_bytes.description: The number of sparse data bytes transferred by this job.

start_time.description: The time the job started in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't started.

subreport_count.description: The number of subreports that are available for this job report.

succeeded_chunks.description: The number of data chunks that have been transmitted successfully.

symlinks_replicated.description: The number of symlinks replicated by this job.

sync_type.description: The type of sync being performed by this job.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

policy_action.description: This is the action the policy is configured to perform.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

or_criteria.description: An array containing objects with "and_criteria" properties, each set of and_criteria will be logically OR'ed together to create the full file matching pattern.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". Note: For time types (accessed_*, birth_*, and changed_*), operator is not required (it is implicitly ==).  For the value, you can use a relative date and time, such as "two weeks ago", or specific date and time, such as "January 1, 2012."  Time settings are based on a 24-hour clock.

attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

DELETE_args.description: Delete all SyncIQ performance rules or all rules of a specified type.

type.description: Delete all rules of the specified rule type only.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

type.description: Filter the returned rules to include only those with this rule type.

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

items.description: A rule limiting the bandwidth, file operations, or cpu usage for all sync jobs on this cluster.

description.description: User-entered description of this performance rule.

enabled.description: Whether this performance rule is currently in effect during its specified intervals.

id.description: The system ID given to this performance rule.

limit.description: Amount the specified system resource type is limited by this rule.  Units are kb/s for bandwidth, files/s for file-count, or processing percentage used for cpu.

schedule.description: A schedule defining when during a week this performance rule is in effect.  If unspecified or null, the schedule will always be in effect.

begin.description: Start time (inclusive) for this schedule, during its specified days.  Format is "hh:mm" (24h format hour, and minute).  A null value indicates the beginning of the day ("00:00").

end.description: End time (inclusive) for this schedule, during its specified days.  Format is "hh:mm" (three-letter weekday name abbreviation, 24h format hour, and minute).  A null value indicates the end of the day ("23:59").

friday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Friday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

monday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Monday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

saturday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Saturday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

sunday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Sunday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

thursday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Thursday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

tuesday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Tuesday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

wednesday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Wednesday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

type.description: The type of system resource this rule limits.

tuesday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Tuesday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

wednesday.description: If true, this rule is in effect on Wednesday.  If false, or unspecified, it is not.

burst_memory_constraint.description: The per-worker burst socket memory constraint, in bytes.

burst_socket_buffer_size.description: The per-worker burst socket buffer coalesced data, in bytes.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Default for the "force_interface" property that will be applied to each new sync policy unless otherwise specified at the time of policy creation.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.

report_email.description: Email sync reports to these addresses.

report_max_age.description: The default length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: The default maximum number of reports to retain for a policy.

restrict_target_network.description: Default for the "restrict_target_network" property that will be applied to each new sync policy unless otherwise specified at the time of policy creation.  If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

service.description: Specifies if the SyncIQ service currently on, paused, or off.  If paused, all sync jobs will be paused.  If turned off, all jobs will be canceled.

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

pool.description: The pool to restrict replication policies to.

subnet.description: The subnet to restrict replication policies to.

tw_chkpt_interval.description: The interval (in seconds) in which treewalk syncs are forced to checkpoint.

PUT_args.description: Modify the global SyncIQ settings.  All input fields are optional, but one or more must be supplied.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

target_path.description: Filter the returned policies to include only those with this target path.

failover_failback_state.description: The condition of this policy with respect to sync failover/failback.

id.description: The system ID given to this sync policy.

last_job_state.description: The state of the last job run for this policy.

last_source_coordinator_ip.description: The IP address from which a SyncIQ coordinator daemon most recently connected to this cluster to update it about the progress of a job for this policy.

last_update_from_source.description: The last time this cluster was updated with sync information from the source cluster for this policy, in unix epoch seconds.  Null if no such update has occurred yet.

legacy_policy.description: Was this policy defined by a OneFS version earlier than 6.0? (Pre-6.0 policies did not have the target policy concept and canceling from the target side will not be available.)

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

source_cluster_guid.description: Unique identifier for the source cluster.

source_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync source cluster.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

flipped_lins.description: The number of LINs flipped by this job.

hard_links_replicated.description: The number of hard links replicated by this job.

hash_exceptions_fixed.description: The number of hash exceptions fixed by this job.

hash_exceptions_found.description: The number of hash exceptions found by this job.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

lins_total.description: The number of LINs tranferred by this job.

network_bytes_to_source.description: The total number of bytes sent to the source by this job.

network_bytes_to_target.description: The total number of bytes sent to the target by this job.

new_files_replicated.description: The number of new files replicated by this job.

num_retransmitted_files.description: The number of files that have been retransmitted by this job.

phases.description: Data for each phase of this job.

end_time.description: The time the job ended this phase.

phase.description: The phase that the job was in.

start_time.description: The time the job began this phase.

regular_files_replicated.description: The number of regular files replicated by this job.

resynced_lins.description: The number of LINs resynched by this job.

retransmitted_files.description: The files that have been retransmitted by this job.

retry.description: The number of times the job has been retried.

running_chunks.description: The number of data chunks currently being transmitted.

sockets_replicated.description: The number of sockets replicated by this job.

source_bytes_recovered.description: The number of bytes recovered on the source.

source_directories_created.description: The number of directories created on the source.

source_directories_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted on the source.

source_directories_linked.description: The number of directories linked on the source.

source_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the source.

source_directories_visited.description: The number of directories visited on the source.

source_files_deleted.description: The number of files deleted on the source.

source_files_linked.description: The number of files linked on the source.

source_files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked on the source.

source_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync source cluster.

sparse_data_bytes.description: The number of sparse data bytes transferred by this job.

start_time.description: The time the job started in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't started.

succeeded_chunks.description: The number of data chunks that have been transmitted successfully.

symlinks_replicated.description: The number of symlinks replicated by this job.

sync_type.description: The type of sync being performed by this job.

target_bytes_recovered.description: The number of bytes recovered on the target.

target_directories_created.description: The number of directories created on the target.

target_directories_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted on the target.

target_directories_linked.description: The number of directories linked on the target.

target_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the target.

target_files_deleted.description: The number of files deleted on the target.

target_files_linked.description: The number of files linked on the target.

target_files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked on the target.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

target_snapshots.description: The target snapshots created by this job.

total_chunks.description: The total number of data chunks transmitted by this job.

total_data_bytes.description: The total number of bytes transferred by this job.

total_files.description: The number of files affected by this job.

total_network_bytes.description: The total number of bytes sent over the network by this job.

total_phases.description: The total number of phases for this job.

unchanged_data_bytes.description: The number of bytes unchanged by this job.

up_to_date_files_skipped.description: The number of up-to-date files skipped by this job.

updated_files_replicated.description: The number of updated files replicated by this job.

user_conflict_files_skipped.description: The number of files with user conflicts skipped by this job.

warnings.description: A list of warning messages for this job.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

autocommit_offset.description: The autocommit time period in seconds for the domain.  After a file exists in this domain without being modified for the specified time period, the file is automatically committed the next time the file is accessed.  If null, there is no autocommit time so files must be manually committed.

default_retention.description: The default amount of time, in seconds, that a file in this domain will be protected for.  This default is applied to a file if it is committed to the domain before being assigned its own expiration date.  Value can also be null (expire right away), 'forever', 'use_min' (use the 'min_retention' value), or 'use_max' (use the 'max_retention' value).

id.description: System-assigned ID of this protection domain.

incomplete.description: If true, OneFS is still in the process of creating this domain and it is not yet preventing files from being modified or deleted.  If false, the domain is fully created and operational.

lin.description: Logical inode number (LIN) for the root of this domain.

max_modifies.description: Maximum number of times a WORM domain can be modified over its lifetime.

max_retention.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a file in this domain will be protected for.  This will override the retention period of any file committed with a longer retention period.  Value can also be null (allow an infinite length retention period).

min_retention.description: The minimum amount of time, in seconds, that a file in this domain will be protected for.  This will override the retention period of any file committed with a shorter retention period.  Value can also be null (expire right away), or 'forever'.

override_date.description: Override retention date for the domain.  If this date is later than any committed file's own retention date, that file will remain protected beyond its own retention date until this date.

path.description: Root path of this domain.  Files in this directory and all sub-directories will be protected.

privileged_delete.description: If 'on', files in this domain can be deleted using the privileged delete feature.  Otherwise, they can't be deleted even with privileged delete.  If 'disabled', privileged file deletes are permanently disabled and cannot be turned back on again.

total_modifies.description: The number of times this domain has been modified (had its domain attributes changed) so far.  A WORM domain can be modified a fixed number of times over its lifetime defined by max_modifies.

type.description: Whether this is an enterprise domain or this is a compliance domain. Compliance domains may not be created on enterprise clusters. Enterprise and compliance domains may be created on compliance clusters.

cdate.description: The current time of the SmartLock compliance clock in Unix epoch seconds, or null if the compliance clock is not set.  To set the compliance clock to the current system time, PUT to this resource with an empty JSON object {} for the cdate value.  This cluster must be in compliance mode to set the compliance clock.

acknowledged.description: If true, only return events that have been acknowledged.

begin.description: Specifies the earliest time to query events from.

coalesced.description: If true, only return events that have been coalesced.

coalescing.description: If true, only return coalescing events.

count.description: If true, return a count of events.

devid.description: Specifies the devid of events to query for.

end.description: Specifies the latest time to query events from.

ended.description: If true, only return events that have ended.

event_type.description: Specifies the event_id of events to query for.

limit.description: Return no more than this many results at once (see resume).

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

severity.description: Specifies the severity of events to query for.

sort.description: The field that will be used for sorting.

items.description: An object representing an event on the cluster.

acknowledged_time.description: The time in epoch seconds at which the event was acknowledged. Set to null when event has not been acknowledged.

coalesced_by_id.description: The ID of the parent event that coalesced this event. Set to null when event has not been coalesced.

devid.description: The ID of the device the event refers to. When set to 0, indicates a cluster event.

end.description: The time in epoch seconds at which the event's lifetime ended. Set to null when the event is still alive.

event_type.description: A number indicating the class or type of the event.

extreme_severity.description: A severity assigned to events that can change severity during their lifetime.

extreme_value.description: A value corresponding to extreme_severity assignment.

id.description: A unique (across all event_types and instances) identifier for an event.

is_coalescing.description: If non-zero this field represents the coalescer type.

message.description: A message containing information about the event.

severity.description: The current severity of the event.

specifiers.description: Key-value pairs containing information specific to this event.

start.description: The time in epoch seconds at which the event's lifetime begins.

update_count.description: The number of times (some parameter of) the event was updated during its lifetime.

value.description: A value associated with the event.

items.description: NFS export configuration values.

all_dirs.description: If true, all directories under the specified paths are mountable.

block_size.description: The block size returned by the NFS STATFS procedure.

can_set_time.description: If true, the client may  set file  times using the NFS SETATTR request.  This  option is advisory and the server always behaves as if it is true.

case_insensitive.description: If true, the server will report that it ignores case for file names.

case_preserving.description: If true, the server will report that it always preserves case for file names.

chown_restricted.description: If true, the server will report that only the superuser may change file ownership.

clients.description: Clients that have access to the export.

commit_asynchronous.description: If true, allows NFS  commit  requests to  execute asynchronously.

conflicting_paths.description: Paths that conflict with another export.

description.description: A human readable description of the export.

directory_transfer_size.description: The preferred size for directory read operations.  This option is advisory.

encoding.description: The character encoding of clients connecting to the export.

link_max.description: The reported maximum number of links to a file.

map_all.description: The user and groups that non-root clients are mapped to.
